Banana Bread

WHITE SUGAR 1 1/4 Cup 
SOFTENED BUTTER 1 1/2 Cup 
EGGES 2 Large 
MASHED RIPE BANANAS 3-4 Numbers 
BUTTER MILK 1 Cup 
VANILLA 1 Teaspoons 
ALL PURPOSE FLOUR 2 1/2 Cup 
BAKING SODA 1 Teaspoons

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Grease bottoms only of 2 loaf pans with shortening.
Mix sugar and butter in large bowl.
Stir in eggs until blended.
Add bananas,buttermilk,and vanilla.
Stir in flour,baking soda.
Mix well.Fill each pan halfway.
Bake about 1 hour to 1 1/4 hours or until toothpick when i nserted in centre comes out clean.
Cool 5 min.
Loosen sides from pan then remove.
Store at room temparature upto 10 days.
Potato Fish Pie Recipe

Potatoes – 1. 75 kg [peeled and cut into chunks
Spring onions – 1 bunch
Salmon fish – 450 gms [boneless skinless salaman fish cut into chunks]
Oil – 3 tbsp
Milk – 150 ml
Egg – 1
Butter – 50 gms
Turmeric powder – 1 tsp
Turai -4 [cut into chnks]
Carddmon – 8 pods
Tomato sauce – 500 gms [fresh]

1. Boil potatoes in water for 20 mins or until tender. Preheat oven to 200 C.
2. Cut white bulbs off the spring onions and roughly chop.
3. Finely slice the green tops and set aside.
4. Spread fish chunks on baking tray and scatter over the chopped spring onions.
5. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper and roast for 6 mins.
6. Drain off liquid and put fish into a 2.5 litre oven dish.
7. Drain potatoes well, add milk and egg and mash.
8. Melt butter in a small pan and cook spring onion tops for 1 minute.
9. Add turmeric and stir for 30 seconds and then add to mashed potato and beat well. Add salt and pepper to taste.
10. Heat remaining olive oil in a large frying pan, add courgettes and fry for 5 mins.
11. Add cardamom pods and fry for 30 secs. Stir in tomato sauce, bring to boil and simmer for 1 min.
12. Season, remove from heat and cool. 
13. our sauce over fish and spring onions and spoon over mash so all sauce and fish are covered.
14. Rough up with fork. Cool, keep covered in fridge. Uncover pie and bake for 35-40 mins
Crunchy Potato Chip Chicken

Chicken – 1 kg {sliced chicken cutlets}
Egg – 1
Milk – 1/2 cup
Potato chips – 1/4 bag
Black pepper – 2 tsp
Paprika – 1/2 tsp
Salt to taste

1. Grease a baking sheet and preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
2. Trim the fat off the chicken breasts, and beat the egg and milk together in a shallow bowl.
3. Fold over the top of the potato chip bag and crush the chips with a rolling pin.
4. Dip the chicken cutlets in the egg mixture and drop them one at a time in the potato chip bag.
5. Fold the top over, give the bag a quick shake, and arrange the coated chicken on the greased baking sheet.
6. After you’ve coated and arranged all the chicken pieces, take any of the leftover chip pieces from the bag and arrange them artfully over the top of the chicken pieces.
7. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper and paprika.
8. Bake the chicken for 20 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Almond and Choco Chip Cookies
All Purpose Flour – 1 3/4 cup\nBaking Powder – 1 tsp\nSalt – 1/4 Tea Spoon

1. Take a mixing bowl, add Maida, baking soda and salt and mix together well and set aside.
2. Take a mixer jar and add 2/3 cups of sugar.
3. Add two large eggs
4. Whisk and combine the eggs and sugar well in high speed until the mixture turns pale and fluffy. Mix for about 5 minutes.
5. Now add the dry mixture to this wet mixture and combine together till all of it is mixed well
6. The mix will look a little crumbly.
7. Now stuff – 3/4 cup of blanched whole almonds or chopped almonds. I had some slivered almonds and used those in place
8. Add the almonds to the dough
9. Next add the chocolate chips along with the almonds.
10. Fold the chocolate chips and almonds into the dough until well combined.
11. Move the dough as a ball on to a parchment paper lined baking sheet.
12. Moisten hands with a little water and press down the dough to form a flat log about 12 inches long and 3-4 inches wide
13. Bake this in a pre heated oven at 350 F for about 25 minutes. The top will firm up after baking. Take the log out of the oven and rest for about 10 minutes
14. Using a serrated knife, cut sidewise into long thick slices
15. Move these slices again to a baking sheet and bake for a second time for about 10 minutes on each side turning them once in between.
16. Now the almond and chocolate chip biscuits are ready.
17. Eat and enjoy the excellent taste of it.
Cardamom Cookies

Unsalted Butter - 1 cup
Sugar - 2 cups
Cardamom Powder (Elachi) - 2 Tea Spoon
Eggs - 4
Fine Wheat Flour (Maida) - 2 cups
Salt - 1 Tea Spoon

1. In a bowl, beat the butter, sugar and cardamom powder for 3 minutes.
2. Then with the beater going add the eggs one at a time.
3. When the mixture gets light take it out in a bowl and add the flour and salt with a light hand.
4. When soft dough gets prepared with the help of a spoon drop them on a nonstick cookie sheet.
5. Place them 1/2″ apart.
6. Bake these cookies in a preheated oven at 325 F for 10 – 11 minutes or till the cookies have a golden color.
7. Repeat the baking procedure for the remaining dough.
Chicken Pasta Bake

Pasta – 5oo gms
Boneless chicken -100 gms
Pasta sauce 300 ml
Oil- 2 tbsp
Cheese 200 gms{grated}
Salt to taste
Pepper – 2tbsp

1. Wash and cut chicken into thin and long pieces.
2. In a deep pan boil 1 liter of water then add salt and 1 TBS spoon of oil.
3. add pasta and boil for 10- 15 minutes or follow the instructions on the packet
4. When the pasta is cooking , in the mean while take remaining oil in a pan and fry chicken for 5 minutes.
5. add pasta sauce to chicken and shimmer for 5- 10 minutes then add salt and pepper.
6. Drain the pasta and mix well with chicken sauce and transfer into a ovenable Big bowl and sprinkle grated cheese.
7. ) Bake it for 5 minutes at 200c preheated oven.
Coconut Cup Cakes

Fine Wheat Flour (Maida) - 6 cups
Baking Powder - 2 tsp
Sodium Bicarbonate - 1 Tea Spoon
Salt - 1 Tea Spoon 
Sugar - 4 cups
unsalted Butter - 1 1/2 cup
Eggs - 6
Almond Essence - 3 Tea Spoon
Vanilla Essence - 3 Tea Spoon
Butter Milk - 2 cups
Coconut - 5 1/2 cups
Cream Cheese - 900 Grams

1. First preheat the oven at 160 degrees.
2. Grease a tin and place pape cases on it.
3. Mix flour, baking powder, soda and salt.
4. Beat and cream sugar and butter.
5. Add eggs one at a time.
6. Now mix the essences.
7. Next add the flour alternatively with the buttermilk.
8. Mix half of the grated coconut.
9. Fill the paper cases with the mixture.
10. Bake them for 25 – 30 minutes or till they are golden in color.
11. For icing beat the cream cheese, butter, sugar and the essence till smooth and creamy.
12. Place a layer of this icing on the bakes cupcakes and sprinkle some coconut on them.
Chicken Parmesan

Bonless chicken – 500 gms
Milk – 1 cup
Egg – 1
Cheese – 8 piece
Pasta sauce – 1 cup
Oil – 1/4 cup
Bread crumbs – as needed

1. Beat egg and milk in a bowl.
2. Dip the chicken pieces in milk, roll in bread crumbs and set aside.
3. Heat olive oil in a skillet.
4. Add chicken pieces, fry till golden and set aside.
5. Grate cheese and cut cheese into small pieces.
6. Spread the chicken pieces in a bowl.
7. Place cut cheese over the chicken.
8. Add pasta sauce, sprinkle grated cheese.
9. Bake at 350 F for half an hour.
10. Serve with garlic bread and salad.
Chicken Stuffed Buns

Active dry yeast-1tbsp
Warm water-2tbsp
Vegetable oil-1/2cup
Milk-1/2cup
Maida-2 1/4cup
Egg-1{betan}
Sugar-2tbsp
Egg white-
 White sesam seeds for sprinkl
CHICKEN STUFFING:
Shredded Chicken-1 1/2cup{cooked}
Ginger garlic paste-1tsp
Corinder powder-1tsp
Red chilli powder-1tsp
Onion-1{chopped}
Cumin powder-one pinch
Coriander leaves-2tbsp
Garam masala powder-one pinch
Salt to taste

1. Dissolve the yeast in warm water with 1/2 tbsp sugar and 1/2 tbsp flour. Leave aside for 10 mts.
2. Boil the milk and cool till it is warm on touch. Add sugar, oil and salt.
3. Mix well with a wooden spoon till the sugar dissolves. Add 1 cup flour and mix to a smooth paste.
4. Add the beaten egg, yeast and mix. Add the remaining flour and mix well till it forms a smooth dough.
5. Knead well for 10 mts. Let it rest till it doubles in volume (approx an hour or two). While its resting prepare the chicken filling.
6. Punch down the dough lightly using your palm and divide the dough equally.
7. Flatten each portion and fill with 1 tbsp of the chicken filling. Re-shape into a smooth ball. Sprinkle the top with sesame seeds.
8. Let it sit/prove for another 20 mins.
9. Bake them in a pre-heated oven at 200 degrees C for 10-12 mts. When it starts to brown, brush tops with egg white.
10. Method for Chicken Filling – Heat oil in a heavy bottomed vessel, add the onions and saute for 4 mts. Add ginger garlic paste and saute for 4 mts.
11. Reduce the heat, add the red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and garam masala powder and mix well.
12. Add the shredded chicken and mix well. Add salt to taste. Cook for 3 mts.
13. Turn off heat and cool. Add coriander leaves and mix.
Fish Cutlets

150g canned tuna fish (any fish you like)
150g potatoes – boiled and mashed
1/2onion – finely chopped
4 -5 garlic cloves – finely chopped
1 x 5cm ginger – finely chopped
2 green chilies – finely chopped
4 -5 curry leaves (I didn’t have it)
½ of a lime or lemon
½ teaspoon chili powder
½ teaspoon Sri Lankan raw curry powder
¼ teaspoon turmeric
¼ teaspoon paprika powder
1 – 1½ tablespoons black pepper powder
3 tablespoons oil

Heat a pan with oil in medium heat.
Then add chopped garlic and ginger. Fry it for nearly 1minute.
Add the onions and fry it till it’s gets light brown.
Now you can add fish or salmon into the pan and and mix it well. Let it cook for nearly 6 - 8 minutes.
Put the heat on law heat and add chili powder, turmeric, pepper and salt, mix the mixture well.
Reduce the heat to low and add mashed potatoes. Mix it well with the fish mixture.
Add lime juice and also taste for salt.
Let it cool nearly 1 hour and now you have make the cutlets to any shape you like. Grab a small handful and slowly form into ball.
Making the Batter OR use the beaten egg:
In a medium bowl, mix the flour, water and pinch of salt together. If you like add pinch of turmeric into the batter.
Deep Frying:
Heat the oil in a large frying pan in medium heat.
When the oil is ready, one by one dip the cutlets in flour batter OR in the beaten eggs and, coated it with bread crumbs well. And deep fry the cutlets till you get a nice golden brown.
Drain the excess oil in kitchen tissues.
NOTES:
1. The most important part when you are forming the cutlet ball, to make sure you don't have any cracks on your cutlet ball. If you have a crack then the cutlet will burst and open when it´s frying.
2. If you don´t like to use the flour batter, you can use the beaten egg for egg washing.
3. If the whole cutlet is not in the oil, make sure you put the oil on the top of the cutlets with a spoon and also remember to turn the sides. If not cutlet will burst from the side which is above the oil.
Butter Cookies

All purpose flour (Maida) - 6 cups
Baking powder - 3 teaspoons
Salt - 1 teaspoon
White sugar - 2 cups
Butter or margarine - 2 cups
Eggs - 2 
Cream - 6 tablespoons
Vanilla extract - 2 teaspoon

1. Sift flour, baking powder, salt and sugar together. Mix well.
2. Add the butter.
3. Add egg, cream and vanilla extract thoroughly.
4. Wrap this dough into a foil and refrigerate for at least 24 hrs.
5. Reheat the oven for 400 degrees.
6. Now roll the dough into a crust which is 1/4 to 1/8 thick.
7. Now with the help of a cookie cutter cut the cookies.
8. Lastly place them on a greased tray and bake them at 400 degrees for 5 – 8 minutes
Bannana Chocolate Cake

Egg - 1
Baking powder - 1 1/2 Tea Spoon
Mashed banana - 1 cup
All purpose flour - 1 1/2 cup
Semi sweet chocolate chips - 3/4 cup
Unsalted butter which is melted - 1/2 cup
Salt - 1/4 Tea Spoon
White sugar - 2/3 cup
Milk - 1/4 cup

1. In a large mixing bowl stir together all purpose flour, sugar, salt and baking powder.
2. Take another bowl and mix together melted butter milk egg and mashed bananas.
3. Now add the banana mixture into the flour mixture until thoroughly blended.
4. Be careful not to over mix.
5. Add the chocolate chips. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F to 175 degrees C.
6. Grease and flour a 9×13 inch pan.
7. Pour the batter into the pan and bake it for 32-35 minutes or until the toothpick inserted into it comes out clean.
8. When the cake gets baked take out the pan from the oven and let it cool for 10-15 minutes.
9. This cake will have some melted chocolate but no crumbs
Honey Cake

Honey - 1 cup
Apple sauce - 1 cup
Eggs - 3
Cinnamon - 1 teaspoon
Clove - 1/2 teaspoon
Nutmeg - 1/2 teaspoon
Rice flour - 1 cup
Wheat flour - 1 cup
Baking powder - 1/2 teaspoon
Baking soda - 1 teaspoo
Decaffeinated coffee - 1 cup

1. Take a large bowl and mix honey, apple sauce and eggs in it.
2. Take another bowl, combine the two flours together and add baking powsder, spices and baking soda to it
3. Add the flour mixture to the wet stuff, alternating with the coffee; beat well.
4. Put into one greased 9″x13″ pan (or, alternatively, three 8″ square pans).
5. Bake at 325F–60-90 minutes for the large pan, 60 minutes for the three smaller pan.
Carrot Cake

All purpose Flour(Maida) - 2 cups
Eggs - 4
Carrot - 4 big ones
Sugar - 2 cups
Oil - 1 1/4 cup
Cinnamon powder - 1 Tea Spoon
Baking soda - 2 Tea Spoon
Almonds - 1/2 cup (small pieces)
Cashews - 1 cup (Fried ones for better taste)

1. Take eggs, sugar and oil in a bowl and blend well
2. Add Maida slowly and stir well and then blend till the Maida mixes well and comes out smooth.
3. Add grated carrots, cinnamon powder, baking soda, half of cashews and almonds to this mixture and mix well.
4. Now take this into a baking tray and add remaining cashews and almonds on top
5. Bake this at 350F to 400F for 40 minutes (Until cooked).
6. Now the delicious and healthy carrot cake is ready
